title: How to Make an Origami Reindeer

steps.title: Start with a square sheet of paper.
steps.content: Start with a square sheet of paper.

steps.title: Fold it across one diagonal, and unfold it again.
steps.content: Fold it across one diagonal, and unfold it again.

steps.title: Fold one side of the square to meet the line made by the diagonal fold.
steps.content: Fold one side of the square to meet the line made by the diagonal fold. Repeat this for the adjacent side of the square.

steps.title: Repeat the previous two steps for the remaining sides of the square without unfolding anything.
steps.content: Repeat the previous two steps for the remaining sides of the square without unfolding anything.

steps.title: Fold it in half, from point to point, as shown, and then unfold it.
steps.content: Fold it in half, from point to point, as shown, and then unfold it.

steps.title: Put your finger in one of the flaps and pull out the point, using the previous fold as a template, and press it down.
steps.content: Put your finger in one of the flaps and pull out the point, using the previous fold as a template, and press it down.

steps.title: Repeat
steps.content: Repeat the previous two steps for the other flap.

steps.title: Fold it in half along its length as shown.
steps.content: Fold it in half along its length as shown.

steps.title: Pull the point that the flaps point towards back into the middle in a reverse fold.
steps.content: Pull the point that the flaps point towards back into the middle in a reverse fold. Flatten it down to construct the neck.

steps.title: Fold both of the flaps back as shown.
steps.content: Fold both of the flaps back as shown. These are your reindeer's front legs.

steps.title: Make a reverse fold
steps.content: Make a reverse fold at the top of the neck, beginning the formation of the head.

steps.title: Unfold the head as shown.
steps.content: Unfold the head as shown.

steps.title: Fold the point underneath to make the nose more flat.
steps.content: Fold the point underneath to make the nose more flat.

steps.title: Fold the top of the head in half over to the opposite side as shown.
steps.content: Fold the top of the head in half over to the opposite side as shown.

steps.title: Make a reverse fold
steps.content: Make a reverse fold and flatten as shown to create the beginnings of the hind legs.

steps.title: Make another reverse fold
steps.content: Make another reverse fold about halfway down the hind legs and flatten it to see the fully formed hind legs.

steps.title: Cut up the back of the neck as shown, without actually completely cutting off any part of the reindeer.
steps.content: Cut up the back of the neck as shown, without actually completely cutting off any part of the reindeer.

steps.title: Split the middle of this flap right up the back of the reindeer's neck.
steps.content: Split the middle of this flap right up the back of the reindeer's neck. You'll end up with four little prongs.

steps.title: Fold the prongs upwards to form antlers and complete the reindeer.
steps.content: Fold the prongs upwards to form antlers and complete the reindeer.

steps.title: Done.
steps.content: Done.
